definition: to make a trip home
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]

sentences.english: Home visits when the meet again tears demobilization yes, yes right mother's thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 探家复员时重逢的泪水是，是对母亲的思念。

sentences.english: The boss deferred Mr Jackson's going home until next month.
sentences.chinese: 老板将杰克逊探家的事推迟到下个月。

definition: to go home to visit one's family
to visit one's parents
to demobilize/demobilization
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to be discharged from military service
on leaving/on the point of departure
native place/place of origin/home state or region
to go on an official or business trip
to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
to return home
to rise through the ranks (as a party cadre)
to return home/fig. to retire from public life
to go to the countryside
to join the army
to take a letter/to send word
